marketNews.title: Story-Driven Valuation: Membeli Masa Depan dengan Harga Hari Ini
marketNews.content: "Cheap valuation is not a guarantee of safety if management is reckless and the business direction is unclear." - fadhilonn

tickerNews.title: BBCA outperforms consensus with 16% YoY Net Profit Growth for Bank Only in 5M25
tickerNews.content: Bank Central Asia (BBCA) recorded net profit for the bank only of 5 trillion Rupiah in May 2025 (+12% YoY, +10% MoM). This result brought the bank only's net profit for 5M25 to 25.2 trillion Rupiah (+16% YoY). Excluding dividend income, net profit for 5M25 grew +10% YoY, relatively higher compared to the 2025F consolidated net profit estimate from consensus at +6.6% YoY.Net Profit Supported by Income Growth and Efficient Opex. Net Interest Income (NII) and Non-Interest Income (Non-II) - excluding dividend income - grew relatively solidly by +7% YoY during 5M25. Meanwhile, opex growth was kept efficient at +4% YoY during 5M25. This dynamic resulted in Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) - excluding dividend income - growing +8% during 5M25.For information, including dividends, Non-II grew +22% YoY during 5M25. Although dividends from subsidiaries are recorded as Non-II in the bank-only financial statements, this income will be eliminated in the consolidated financial statements.NIM and CoC Recovered in May 2025; Liquidity Quite Good. On a monthly basis, both Net Interest Margin (NIM) and credit cost (CoC) improved post-Lebaran in April 2025. NIM was recorded at 5.86% in May 2025 (vs. April 2025: 5.56%), while CoC was at 0.18% in May 2025 (vs. April 2025: 0.59%). This result brought the realization of NIM during 5M25 to 5.73%, in line with management's 2025 guidance in the range of 5.7-5.8%. The realized CoC itself stood at 0.37% during 5M25, still higher than management's 2025 guidance of 0.3%.BBCA's liquidity is relatively good with a Loan-to-Deposit Ratio (LDR) at 80% and the CASA Ratio increasing again to 83.2% as of May 2025 along with Current Account growth (+12% YoY, +4% MoM). BBCA's sufficiently good liquidity condition supports credit growth which is still quite strong at +12% YoY as of May 2025.Key Takeaway: We assessed BBCA's bank-only performance during 5M25 as quite positive. NIM is in line with guidance, while credit cost (CoC) is still higher than guidance but improved in May 2025. Loan growth as of May 2025 is also still recorded fast, albeit with a slowing trend in line with management targets. We also highlight interest income which rose to 8 trillion Rupiah in May 2025 (+9% YoY, +4% MoM). This interest income growth may indicate a beginning rise in lending yield, in line with management's intention.

tickerNews.title: BRMS Considers Quasi Reorganization, Targets Multiplied Production
tickerNews.content: BRMS: Bumi Resources Minerals Director, Herwin Hidayat, stated that they are studying the option of quasi reorganization as an effort to overcome the balance sheet deficit reaching 760 million US dollars or 12.4 trillion Rupiah as of the end of 2024. Herwin also added that the company wants to accelerate reaching a surplus on return on risk in 2028 or in the next 5-6 years, so that dividend distribution can be implemented in the next 5 years. Herwin added that BRMS targets the underground gold mine project in Palu, Central Sulawesi, to start operating in 4Q27. This mine is estimated to have a gold grade of 3.5-4.9 grams per ton, higher than the grade from the open-pit mine which is only around 1-1.5 grams per ton. With this potential, BRMS targets its gold production volume to increase to 150,000 troy ounces in 2028 and 200,000 troy ounces in 2029 (vs. 2024 realization: 64,983 troy ounces).

tickerNews.title: MEDC announces first oil lifting from Forel field in South Natuna Sea Block B
tickerNews.content: MEDC: Medco Energi Internasional announced that the company successfully conducted its first oil lifting from the Forel gas and oil field in the South Natuna Sea Block B. Production from this field has reached 10,000 barrels of oil per day, equivalent to ~6.7% of the gas and oil production as of 1Q25 which stood at 150,000 barrels of oil equivalent per day. The Forel field was inaugurated by President Prabowo Subianto on May 16, 2025.

tickerNews.title: ENRG plans private placement to fund drilling and procurement activities
tickerNews.content: ENRG: Energi Mega Persada announced that the proceeds from the private placement plan will be used by the company's subsidiary to finance drilling activities in the Malacca Strait Block as well as to finance the procurement of goods and services outside of those drilling activities. In this corporate action, ENRG will issue ~2.5 billion new shares, but the exercise price and prospective investors have not yet been announced. This plan will be discussed at the GMS Extraordinary Meeting on June 26, 2025.

tickerNews.title: UBS Group AG transfers ~14.1 billion BUMI shares, increasing stake to 6.66%
tickerNews.content: BUMI: UBS Group AG announced the transfer of ~14.1 billion Bumi Resources shares on June 5, 2025. UBS Group AG explained that this transaction was directed by its client to consolidate assets through UBS. After this transaction, the ownership held under the name of UBS Group AG in BUMI increased from 2.86% to 6.66%.

tickerNews.title: EMTK increases stake in SCMA through open market purchases
tickerNews.content: SCMA: The controller of Surya Citra Media, Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK), bought ~288.6 million SCMA shares at an average price of 174 Rupiah per share between March 21 and June 11, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~50 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 63.63% to 64.02%.

tickerNews.title: AMMN President Director resigns pending commissioner appointment; Arief Widyawan Sidarto proposed as successor
tickerNews.content: AMMN: Amman Mineral Internasional announced that the President Director, Alexander Ramlie, has submitted his resignation letter on June 14, 2025, in connection with his planned appointment as a company commissioner. AMMN also announced that the company proposes Arief Widyawan Sidarto as a candidate for President Director. Arief currently serves as a director at AMMN. Both plans will be discussed at the Annual General Meeting of Shareholders (AGMS) on June 16, 2025.

tickerNews.title: JTPE to distribute 2024 final dividend of IDR 17 per share, yielding ~6.5%
tickerNews.content: JTPE: Jasuindo Tiga Perkasa will distribute a dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to ~164.5 billion Rupiah or a ~69% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~69%). This amount is equivalent to a final dividend of 17 Rupiah per share and indicates a final dividend yield of ~6.5% as of Monday (16/6). The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is June 20, 2025, while payment is on July 10, 2025. Previously, JTPE distributed an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of 7 Rupiah per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: KBLM to distribute 2024 dividend of IDR 20 per share, yielding ~6.5%
tickerNews.content: KBLM: Kabelindo Murni will distribute a dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 22.4 billion Rupiah or 20 Rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a 29% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~29%) and indicates a dividend yield of ~6.5% as of Monday (16/6). The cum date in the regular and negotiation markets is June 19, 2025, while payment is on July 11, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Indonesia Stock Exchange considers extending trading hours to attract foreign investors
tickerNews.content: The President Director of the IDX, Iman Rachman, said that the exchange is considering extending trading hours from 09:00-16:00 WIB to 08:00-17:00 WIB. This step is intended to attract foreign investors to the Indonesian stock exchange, help increase trading volume, and allow investors to respond to global events in real-time.

tickerNews.title: Danantara allocates 20% of capital for overseas investment as part of global expansion
tickerNews.content: The CEO of BPI Danantara, Rosan Roeslani, said that 20% of Danantara's total capital will be allocated for overseas investment to expand its business scope globally. Meanwhile, the remaining 80% will be focused on strategic domestic projects, especially priority sectors for national development. Rosan mentioned that with capital reaching 7 billion US Dollars sourced from dividends, Danantara can achieve up to 5x leverage, equivalent to an investment fund potential of 35 billion US Dollars per year.

tickerNews.title: China's May 2025 Retail Sales surpass expectations, marking strongest growth since Dec 2023
tickerNews.content: China's national statistics bureau recorded that retail sales in China grew +6.4% YoY in May 2025 (vs. Apr 2025: +5.1% YoY), exceeding consensus expectations at +5% YoY. This result marks the strongest growth since December 2023, driven by increased holiday spending during Labor Day and the Dragon Boat Festival, as well as efforts by the Chinese government to mitigate the impact of US tariff pressures.

tickerNews.title: China's unemployment rate slightly decreased to 5% in May 2025, lowest since Nov 2024
tickerNews.content: China's national statistics bureau recorded that the unemployment rate in China fell slightly to 5% in May 2025 (vs. Apr 2025: 5.1%), below consensus expectations of 5.1%. This result marks the lowest level since November 2024.

tickerNews.title: ESDM sets June 2025 second period Reference Coal Price (HBA) down 10.7% MoM to $98.61/ton
tickerNews.content: The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) set the Reference Coal Price (HBA) for the second period of June 2025 down -10.7% MoM to 98.61 US dollars per ton. This HBA is also down -2.3% compared to the HBA in the first period of June 2025.

tickerNews.title: TLDN completes acquisition of PT Cipta Davia Mandiri for less than expected price
tickerNews.content: TLDN: Teladan Prima Agro announced that it has acquired 99.99% shares of PT Cipta Davia Mandiri for 136 billion Rupiah. The transaction value is lower than the acquisition agreement announced in April 2025 in the range of 160-210 billion Rupiah. Previously, Kontan reported that PT Cipta Davia Mandiri manages approximately 3,100 hectares of oil palm plantations, so the total planted area owned by TLDN will increase to approximately 63,500 hectares after this acquisition is completed.

tickerNews.title: PRAY acquires ~51% stake in PT Lynas Medikal for distribution business
tickerNews.content: PRAY: Famon Awal Bros Sedaya announced that it has acquired ~51% shares of PT Lynas Medikal for ~17.3 billion Rupiah from a non-affiliated party. The company also plans to purchase an additional 10% stake for 3.4 billion Rupiah within 1 month after the acquisition date, bringing the company's ownership in PT Lynas Medikal to 61%. PT Lynas Medikal operates in the field of medical device and pharmaceutical distribution.

tickerNews.title: SDMU plans private placement to convert IDR 61.4 billion debt to controlling shareholder
tickerNews.content: SDMU: Sidomulyo Selaras announced a private placement plan of ~2.27 billion new shares to convert debt totaling ~61.4 billion Rupiah to the company's controller, Tjoe Mien Sasminto. The exercise price is set at 27 Rupiah per share, resulting in a dilution effect of up to 66.68%. This plan will be discussed at the GMS Extraordinary Meeting on July 22, 2025.
